00335 template<class T>
00336 class Observer : public IObserverTemplated<T>
00337 {
00338 private:
00339     typedef void(T::*NotifyMethod)(INotification*);
00340     typedef T* NotifyContext;
00341     NotifyMethod notifyMethod;
00342     NotifyContext notifyContext;
00343 public:
00354     Observer( NotifyMethod method, NotifyContext context )
00355     {
00356         this->setNotifyMethod(method);
00357         this->setNotifyContext(context);
00358     }
00367     void setNotifyMethod( NotifyMethod method )
00368     {
00369         this->notifyMethod = method;
00370     }
00376     void setNotifyContext( NotifyContext context )
00377     {
00378         this->notifyContext = context;
00379     }
00385     NotifyMethod getNotifyMethod()
00386     {
00387         return this->notifyMethod;
00388     }
00394     NotifyContext getNotifyContext()
00395     {
00396         return this->notifyContext;
00397     }
00403     void notifyObserver( INotification* notification )
00404     {
00405         (this->notifyContext->*notifyMethod)(notification);
00406     }
00413     bool compareNotifyContext( unsigned int compareContextMemoryAddress )
00414     {
00415         return compareContextMemoryAddress == (unsigned int) &*this->getNotifyContext();
00416     }
00417 };

00860 //--------------------------------------
00861 //  Controller
00862 //--------------------------------------
00896 class Controller : public MultitonKeyHeir, public IController
00897 {
00898 public:
00912     Controller();
00918     static IController* getInstance( std::string key );
00925     template<class T>
00926     void executeCommand( INotification* note )
00927     {
00928         // this is a special to c++ function,
00929         // i feel like we're cheating here, but
00930         // it's nice, but we had to get rid of
00931         // executeCommand and registerCommand
00932         // from IController for it... ...if you
00933         // can think of a better way to keep this
00934         // commands stateless through this execution
00935         // then be my guest to revise this. - Schell
00936         std::string name = note->getName();
00937         // if this command isn't listed, abort
00938         if(! this->hasCommand(name))
00939             return;
00940         // make a new instance of the command
00941         ICommand* command = new T();
00942         command->initializeNotifier(this->getMultitonKey());
00943         command->execute(note);
00944         // get rid of the evidence
00945         delete command;
00946     };
00962     //void registerCommand( std::string notificationName, ICommand* commandClassRef );
00963     template<class T>
00964     void registerCommand(std::string notificationName)
00965     {
00966         // if we've already registered a command for this notification
00967         // abort
00968         if(this->hasCommand(notificationName))
00969             return;
00970         // create an observer for this command
00971         Observer<Controller>* observer = new Observer<Controller>(&Controller::executeCommand<T>, this);
00972         // register the observer with the view
00973         this->view->registerObserver(notificationName, observer);
00974         // give the commanMap something to chew on
00975         commandMap[notificationName] = (T*) 0;
00976     };
00983     bool hasCommand( std::string notificationName );
00984 
00990     void removeCommand( std::string notificationName );
00991 
00997     static void removeController( std::string key );
00998     
00999 protected:
01007     void initializeController();
01008     
01009     // Local reference to View
01010     IView* view;
01011 
01012     // Mapping of Notification names to Command Class references
01013     std::map<std::string, ICommand*> commandMap;
01014 };
